meanings.definition: The practice of participating in community activities and organizations.
meanings.sent1: Civicism is about being involved in local events and groups.
meanings.sent2: She showed her civicism by volunteering at the neighborhood clean-up.
meanings.sent3: The town's civicism was evident in the large turnout for the charity fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to civicism shone brightly in his commitment to improving public spaces.
meanings.sent5: Participating in civicism makes our community stronger and more united.

meanings.definition: The belief in the importance of civic duty.
meanings.sent1: For her, civicism means always putting the needs of the community first.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's speech emphasized the value of civicism in shaping a better society.
meanings.sent3: His extreme civicism led him to run for every local election, even dog catcher.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, true civicism emerges as people come together to help one another.
meanings.sent5: Teaching children about civicism early on can instill a sense of responsibility towards society.

meanings.definition: The study of the rights and responsibilities of citizens.
meanings.sent1: Civicism involves learning about what it means to be a good citizen.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a course on civicism to educate students on civic engagement.
meanings.sent3: Studying civicism may not be everyone's cup of tea, but it's essential for informed citizenship.
meanings.sent4: The professor's passion for civicism inspired many students to pursue careers in public service.
meanings.sent5: Understanding civicism helps individuals navigate their role in society more effectively.
